metadata.Title: CVE-2018-19217 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - low
metadata.Description:
** DISPUTED ** In ncurses, possibly a 6.x version, there is a NULL pointerdereference at the function _nc_name_match that will lead to a denial ofservice attack. NOTE: the original report stated version 6.1, but the issuedid not reproduce for that version according to the maintainer or areliable third-party.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-19217` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

lib32ncurses5 - 6.1-1ubuntu1
lib32ncursesw5 - 6.1-1ubuntu1
lib32tinfo5 - 6.1-1ubuntu1
lib64ncurses5 - 6.1-1ubuntu1
lib64tinfo5 - 6.1-1ubuntu1
libncurses5 - 6.1-1ubuntu1
libncursesw5 - 6.1-1ubuntu1
libtinfo5 - 6.1-1ubuntu1
libx32ncurses5 - 6.1-1ubuntu1
libx32ncursesw5 - 6.1-1ubuntu1
libx32tinfo5 - 6.1-1ubuntu1
ncurses-base - 6.1-1ubuntu1
ncurses-bin - 6.1-1ubuntu1
ncurses-examples - 6.1-1ubuntu1
ncurses-term - 6.1-1ubuntu1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: ncurses package in esm-infra/bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.1-1ubuntu1').
